NervousNoobz 30-Sep-19 01:04 PM
Newt led Rex to the small bar and lounge air run by a heavy set dwarf. As they walked in Newt would wave a hand to the bartender "Hey short stack! Get me two of your shitty ale!" Seeing her walk in the dwarf just rolls his eyes and smirks "I didnt hear you ask nicely midget" Newt just growled at him and flipped him off before the dwarf chuckled and went to get two ales. Newt hopped up on the bar stool and pulled one off for Rex "Sit"

Rhost 30-Sep-19 01:24 PM
He walks over and sits down, still a couple feet above her. He looks down at her and then at the dwarf "Hello." then back at her "Are you this friendly with everyone?"
NervousNoobz 30-Sep-19 01:30 PM
The dwarf nodded a head at the large man, then laughed out loud at his comment "Yeah shes a real fucken charmer ey" Newt just flipped him off again then smirked and looked back over to Rex "I dont know about all that but, i just talk to whoever i want and whether they want to talk back is there prerogative. Dont bother me much either way" The dwarf placed the drinks down infront of them and Newt immediately took a big chug out of it, some of the ale dripping down the corner of her lip and down her chin before she slammed the mug back down and burped "What about you? you seem like a bundle of fucken joy, what brought you here"
Rhost 30-Sep-19 01:32 PM

NervousNoobz 30-Sep-19 01:43 PM

Its called stalking." she looked at him very sternly for a few awkard moments before breaking it with a smirk and punching his arm playfully "i'm just fucken with you, but that is a bit suspicious. what the hell would you want to learn from me"
Rhost 30-Sep-19 04:54 PM

NervousNoobz 30-Sep-19 08:45 PM
"Oh fucken hell! the damn lad is making a mess on my floor!" The dwarf roared out as Newt was just laughing on the stood as Rex passed out onto the bar "Holy shit dat wis a lot m're challenging den i expected. pups got gusto" she said in a drunken slur as she hopped out off of the stool almost stumbling down before she caught herself. "Will you just get that damn boy upstairs before he blows chucks all over my bar!" Newt gave the dwarf a playful salute then moved over to Rex and lifted his large muscular arm over her small but strong shoulders and wrapped her arm around his back. She lifted him up from the stood and began to drag him upstairs, the weight of his heavy body wasnt to much for her to handle but it sure was a lot. "Damn pup your fucken heavy" Newt dragged the man upstairs and slammed opened to door to her room with her foot before she dragged him in, his legs sliding acrossed the floor as she moved him. Once she made it to the bed she counted "1...2...3!" And tossed him onto the back, the mattress creaking and depressing under his heavy weight "Well fuck..his big ass takes up so much of the damn bed." She looked at the muscular man sprawled out on her bed and sighed which turned into a yawn. "Fuck it im not sleeping on the ground" Newt walked around the other side of the bed as she began removing the oversized pieces of her clothing. Kicking her pants off as well as her shirt. She was left with a small undershirt and shorts as she crawled onto the bed next to him.
She then reached back under her shirt and removed the chest bindings letting her large breasts breath for the night as they bounces from the sudden relief "Ahhh much better, god it would be so much easier if i didn't have tits." Newt laid back into the bed next to Rex and looked over to him. His hair was partially covering his chiseled face as his cheek was smooshed against the pillow, she chuckled at the sight of him. Her ears wiggling as she laughed. Her tail began to wag under her rear as she laid on it, while she let out a relaxed breath. Then suddenly her ears perked up as an arcane collar formed around his neck. A devious grin came a crossed her face as she realized but it meant (edited)
Rhost 30-Sep-19 08:51 PM
Rex is a heavy snorer as he sleeps, his rather massive body going up and down as he breathes
NervousNoobz 30-Sep-19 09:31 PM
Newts eyes shot open when she heard him snore loudly. The sounds practically vibrating the whole bed. She grumbled and turned to face him covering his mouth with her hands "Damn pup your so loud!" She her hand was pressed against his surprisingly soft lips she look to moment to full exam the features on his face. He was classically handsome which Newt didn't seem to notice till now. But seeing him still brought her back to that time. The time she was a hollow of person. Numb to the world. The only relief in the form of that adrenaline and pain of battle. She didn't like to think about those times but, it was nice to know she wasn't the only one who got out. Newt stared at him for a moment and let out a heavy sigh. "I'm sorry for what I'm going to do...just know..this will probably hurt me more then it hurts you.." Newt said in a genuinely somber tone before she drifted off to sleep

Avrae BOT 01-Oct-19 08:54 AM
NervousNoobz 07-Oct-19 10:12 AM
Namira would lead Tsuzuko to the various parts of the ship. Her face still glued to the piece of parchment as she mumbled seemingly random words under her breathe. Watson would be following behind them both. The bear creeked as it poked Tsu in the shoulder. It would almost seemed organic if not for the cold feeling of metal against his shoulder. Namira's tail would idly sway back and forth, occasionally brushing against Tsu arm and cheek. After a few moments of unknowingly awkward silence Namira finally spoke "So what does your kind eat?" @zzo (edited)
zzo 07-Oct-19 10:30 AM
Tsuzuto was half in a fog, walking with his dreamy gaze fixed on Namira and her delightful tail. The softness of it was--transcendental, even more than the goose down he found tucked into the hollows of old growth trees in the spring. Hells, he barely even minded the pokes from her automaton, only giving his love drunk smile to Watson in return. Namira's question gives him pause. He had to wonder, but the tales told to him by his parents suggest that the Yuan Ti have quite the niche diet. "Hmm," He hums, tapping his lips pensively, "I eat as all humans do, Nami-tan. Though I cannot speak for the others of my kind, as I've yet to meet any..." His face betrays a bit of internal self-rebuking over not being able to feed her anything aside from the horror stories told by his parents. "My parents have told me that, in ancient times, that the Yuan Ti were infamously violent creatures. Perhaps they are carnivores?" (edited)
NervousNoobz 07-Oct-19 11:41 AM
Even though it didn't appear so by her eyes being fixed on the page, Namira listened intently and paused in place as he finished speaking. A spark of curiosity hit her as she turned around to face Tsuzuto and walked over to him. She put the note in her pocket and then without warning she reached up and cupped the sides of Tsu's cheeks with her velvet soft hands. She then ran her thumb along his lips before hooking it into his mouth and lifting his lip up to see if he had fangs "So do you have fangs? Do they distribute poison?"
zzo 07-Oct-19 11:52 AM
"Ahh, Gah hangaggan ganah." Tsuzuto replies, in a rush and brought to flushing pink once more as she handled his face. He tastes the salt of her skin, still lingering where it touched his lips and teeth with his purple tongue, which was curiously split near the tip, though still muscular like a human's. As her thumb retreats, he would reply again. "Ah, I am sharp in the tooth, but no so long, Nami-tan~" He smiles to her and her inquisitive nature, allows her to search as she pleases. "I do possess a--poison of sorts. Not by the fang, of course, but here," Tsuzuto would gently clasp her hand in one of his, and guide her pointer finger down his free hand's palm, stopping it on a slightly protruding nodule on his wrist. "It is purely a defense mecanism," He says, unable to wipe away his smile, head tilting to better take in that cute look she had when she was in thought. "Have I mentioned that you do not have the hands of a metal worker, Nami-tan?" (edited)
NervousNoobz 07-Oct-19 12:31 PM
Nami tilted her head when she saw the purple tongue that was split at the tip. Her finger tip poking at the tip of his sharp tooth. Her ears wiggled excitedly when he mentioned having a poison. She followed his hands with her amber eyes as her gently grab her finger and slid it along his palm. Her eyes widened when she felt the small protrusion on his wrist. She grabbed his hand with both of hers and began to examine his wrist more closely. Running her fingers along his wrist as she answered him "Oh that, yeah I think it has to do with me being half Eladrin. Also a lot of my work arcane base, and I can heal so i don't usually scar." She lifted his hand up over her head and looked closely at his wrist "So what does this defense mechanism do? How do I get it out?" she asked as she pushed her thumb against his wrist "Make it come out"
@zzo
zzo 07-Oct-19 12:47 PM
"Ahhehehehe~!" It tickled, oh it tickled terribly as she finagled with it. "N-Nami-tan..! It is dangerous you know...!" Though he still tried to let her satisfy her curiosity, he wasn't about to loose a gout of poisonous gas on poor Namira. His eyes watered from the strange and absurdly ticklish sensation of having his venom gland prodded at, hips shooting one way or the other in an effort to contain himself. "I-if you keep touching there, I won't be able to--!" Tsuzuto clenches his teeth and takes a deep breath, could he hold out? (edited)
Avrae BOT 07-Oct-19 12:47 PM
Tsuzuto makes a Constitution Save!
1d20 (5) + 2 = 7
zzo 07-Oct-19 12:49 PM

Avrae BOT 07-Oct-19 12:53 PM
Tsuzuto casts Poison Spray!
Meta
Damage: 1d12 (6) [poison] = 6 DC: 13 CON Save
Effect
The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d12 poison damage.
NervousNoobz 08-Oct-19 10:06 AM
Suddenly a puff of noxious gas would expel from Tsu wrist and engulf the curious half tabaxi in its poisonous fumes. She would instantly start to violently cough and heave as Tsu pulled her in closer by her waist. Nami would bury her face into his shoulder and cling to him as she used his the fabric of his close as a barrier to keep the rest of the fumes out of her lungs. Wetting the yukata with her tears as she continued to cough uncomfortably in attempts to shake the stinging on her throat "F-fuck me! cough cough that cough is some cough defence mechanism cough cough neat!" strangely enough she did not seem anger or upset at all from the fumes that burned her throat, if anything she looked more curious
@zzo
zzo 08-Oct-19 10:17 AM
Tsuzuto was cringing head to toe in embarassment, flapping away the remaining gas that lingered with one arm. He jockies her a few steps back from it, and laments that he couldn't better savor holding her so closely, damn his eyes... "Nami-tan! I-I'm so sorry! Come, come, we need to get you some water right away..!" Leading her further to the bar lounge, he would tenderly set Namira against something sturdy, bar, stool, it made no difference. He would quickly go and procure two glasses of cold water. In one glass, he would dip a tiny bit of his sleeve into. Once wetted, he would pinch it between thumb and forefinger, then go to wipe away any residue from around her eyes and face. "My deepest apologies, Nami-tan...please let me just wipe this away, and you should drink..." There was lamentation in his voice, as though he'd killed her or something. Even if it that was far from the case, there was an indelibly deep frown on his face as he cleaned off Namira's with gentle swipes of his wet sleeve.
"I am relieved you aren't more hurt...Have you always been such a curious creature?"
NervousNoobz 08-Oct-19 02:05 PM
Namira continued to hack violently at poison coating her throat. She let Tsu lead her further into the lounge and sat her down against the wall. She tilted her head up to the gently swiping of her tear filled eyes as she lifted the water to her lips and chugged it. She put the drink down with gasp and looked up at him. Watery amber pools look into his before she gave him a weak smile "Relax..I'm fine, believe me i have had much worse done to me...thats a fascinating skill you have." when he asked about her curiosity her ears wiggled again "Pretty much, it might be the tabaxi in me."
she coughed a few times more before taking another drink of water "So what else can you do?"
zzo 08-Oct-19 02:40 PM
Tsuzuto smiles in spite of himself. That curiosity may not always be for the best, but he was guilty of it himself from time to time. A restrained laugh of a breath escapes through his nose as he looks into Namira's watery eyes, sees the cute expressions she can make with her ears, then pulls his hand away from her face. "Besides practicing medicine and a little magic, I merely mind the forest for those that dwell there...I am not so complex a creature as all that, Nami-tan...another drink? Does it hurt anywhere?" Tsuzuto gathers up the one empty and one soiled glass and makes ready to dote on her. If only he could make tea as good as Wesley's...the extent of his own skill in that regard yielded purely holistic remedies and tasted quite foul, he'd been told. As he brings the glasses back to the bar for cleaning, Tsuzuto would indulge Namira with a few more details, if for no other reason than to occupy her dangerously inquisitive mind for a moment longer. "...That same poison you just felt has no effect on my kind, by the way," he says from nearer the bar, "Nor do the venoms of any other creature, great or small. And as you may have guessed, I do--have some clout, among the serpents of the world..." Clinking glass could be heard as he finagled about, "Will you not tell me of yourself, Nami-tan? The Wyvern's Captain seems to hold you in high regard; though, since having met you, I believe I understand this notion better."
NervousNoobz 09-Oct-19 01:38 AM
Namira nodded as Tsuzuto explained what he did. Made sense to her Druid, protecting the forest. All that. She only knew a bit about the forest since she spent most of her time at sea or in the skies. whatever little she knew of the forest came from what her mother would tell her when she was younger. When he asked if she was hurting anywhere without missing a beat she answered honestly "Well my eyes sting like someone poured lemon into them. And my throat feels like i just chugged a bunch of sand. But other then that yeah i'm okay" Even when she was in pain, everything came out of her so causally like nothing phased her unless it involved getting in the way of her constant pursuit of distraction for her never resting mind. When he mentioned the poison not effecting him her ears perked up as she tail swayed a bit faster with intrigue "Really? how? is you body just immune to it? how much of your body has the traits of a serpent and how much is like a human?" she drilled him with more question as he seemed she was eager to learn everything she could about a race she was unfamiliar with. Immunities to poisons was a rare trait and she was curious if she could somehow extract that from him. When the line of questioning turned towards her she just tilted her head and answered in quick secession almost as if she didn't have time to bother talking about herself "I was his first mate for a while. I know a lot about driving air ships and sea vessels since my dad was captain. Mostly air ships but he started in the sea. He's dead now though" She said nonchalantly as she reached into her pocket and pulled the piece of paper with the symbols that the captain gave her back out of her pocket (edited)
zzo 09-Oct-19 05:26 AM
Tsuzuto returns to Namira with a fresh glass of water, and would sit down in front of her. The frown was still somewhat visible, though whether it was because of his having savaged her with poison, or because of her tale, was up for debate. Likely, it was a good bit of both. "I see...you are very strong and even more talented than I had presumed, Nami-tan...Um--" He stumbles over his thoughts near the end, not fond of seeing her in pain. There came an awkward shifting from him. "I would like to indulge you with all I know, but seeing you in this condition breaks my heart down the middle...I can heal you, if you would allow it? I would offer an herbal solution but--I have already hurt you enough to last a thousand lifetimes." Gallows humor. Tsuzuto smiles beleaguredly at his own attempt to insert the self-deprecating joke. The way she was so deliberate with speaking her mind, despite the poison, he ventured to guess she was like this all the time. She was so strong, and it sent warm feelings through him, shame and respect, and something stronger. "Of course I am also interested in knowing if the Captain had anything important to say...Not that I mean to pry, mind you...Still, I must digress, may I heal you Nami-tan? I know the process is--uncomfortable, for some..." (edited)
NervousNoobz 09-Oct-19 03:22 PM
Namira squinted her eyes, trying to decipher the symbols on the page but her eyes where much to sore and watery for her to read them. She huffed and puffed out her cheeks. When he mentioned healing her she parted her lips, about to say she could heal herself but was curious about his ability so she instead just answered "Yeah alright. Go for it. Heal me. I need to decipher this but I can't read it like this and their are a few symbols I'm not familiar with." she grabbed the drink and chugged the water before scooting closer to Tsu and leaning into him a bit closer for him to heal her
@zzo
zzo 09-Oct-19 03:50 PM
He feels what little weight Namira has press into him, hears the rustle of fabric. Even her exotic scent managed to cut through the lingering odor his spent poison spray...he still felt like a heel. Tsuzuto had never used magic to seal with poison before, in fact he rarely used magic at all when treating the injured, but from the looks of this place and those he'd met since his short time on the Wyvern, he may as well start getting used to it. "As you wish." Tsuzuto would reach around her shoulder so that he could more easily place his index finger onto her forehead, just under her hat. He swallows. Sylvan "...Cure Wounds." They fey sounding words rippled out of his mouth, and a fuzzy looking glow pulses out from his chest, lights up his sleeve as it travels down his arm, through his finger, then finally makes contact with Namira. It spreads throughout her form as white bands of light rippling like the words Tsuzuto had spoken, and echoes in her ears, a deep thrumming sound. (edited)
Avrae BOT 09-Oct-19 03:50 PM
Tsuzuto casts Cure Wounds!
Meta
Damage: - ( 1d8 (6) + 3 ) [heal] = -9
Effect
A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
NervousNoobz 09-Oct-19 04:53 PM
As the spell travelled through Tsuzuto's arm and up to his fingers Namira just watched. Closely examining the arcane energy that was coursing through him. She glanced up at him when he spoke in Sylvan. Familiar with the language from what her mother has taught her when she was younger. As soon as the spell reached her skin the delightful effects of the healing magic rippled through her body sending a wave of euphoric sensations through her body. Namira let out a soft cooing sound as she trembled under his finger. The feeling of the healing magic was so much more intense when someone else did it to her. Her breathe became heavier as she looked up at Tsu with a blissful expression. Sylvan: "That feels so much better when you do it to me then when I do it" she blurted out is a small voice accompanied by a low whimper, oblivious to how it sounds and how her flushed expression appeared to Tsu. (edited)
@zzo
zzo 09-Oct-19 05:06 PM
Tsuzuto felt his face go red. Namira looks at him with that look, and it was like he'd seen her for the first time, all over again. Everything from the way her voice quivered through her words, down to the little shudders he felt her make in his chest, it all had set his heart racing. An unintended, but very much welcomed effect. Sylvan"D-does it...? I am relieved, to know it is...effective." He was like a rodent before a speeding carriage, unsure of which way to run, likely to end up crushed beneath the wheels. Tsuzuto removes his finger, and allows the magic to finish its job. Though, his arm stayed about her shoulders, one hand gently holding her steady by her upper arm. His face was only a few shades lighter than his wide, awestruck eyes at this point. Tsuzuto switches back to common as the magic ripples slow to a stop, and fade away. "Can you see any better now, Nami-tan?" (edited)
zzo 09-Oct-19 05:13 PM
@NervousNoobz
NervousNoobz 10-Oct-19 04:54 AM
Namira closed her eyes as she whimpered softly and sighed with satisfaction as the magic finished its work on healing her sore throat and cloudy eyes. Her racing heart beats slowly went back to an even pace as the magic faded while the tingling of her body subsided. Her eyes fluttered opened and looked up at the red faced Yuan ti that has just sent her body into a mini euphoria. She reached up and gently placed her hand on his cheek "You're face is red, and warm...does healing take a long out of you?" She asked oblivious that her lack of proximity between them was only make his face a deep shade of red. She then looked down at the paper again, seeing the symbols more clearly as her eyes where no longer sore "Ah there we are. Good work Tsu"
NervousNoobz 10-Oct-19 05:06 AM
@zzo
zzo 10-Oct-19 05:37 AM
Tsuzuto leans his face unbidden into the touch of her palm, relished in the sensation of it. Exactly how and when did he get so lucky? "On the contrary, Nami-tan. I am not less than before, but am filled to bursting..." His own hand would come up to meet hers while it still rested upon his hot cheek, moving away only once hers did. "And it is not the magic that is responsible.." His heart swells, engorged to the point where he felt like it might burst from his ribcage. Then she looks at the Captain's note with her renewed eyes, and her praise, her uttering his name; it set his swollen heart alight with fire. Oh how he wanted to tell her, sing it to her, write it out in the sky if he could, that she was the answer to a question that life had asked him, but he'd never had a response for until today...Would it scare her away if he did? "I am honored by your praise Nami-tan, even though I was the one to injure you to begin with...Is everything well with the Captain?" Coward, he tells himself. Well, one side of his brain tells him anyway; not an aspect of himself with which he was familiar, more primal, unknown.
@NervousNoobz
NervousNoobz 10-Oct-19 10:30 AM
Namira didn't notice the intoxicated look on Tsuzuto's face as he leaned into her warm palm. She was much more distracted by the scales along his neck. Her fingers gently running along his scales before she pulled her hand away. She didn't understand or recognize the feelings he was having for her. But she did feel something. A strange interest in this curious Yuan ti. "Don't stress it Tsu. I am the one who asked you to do it. Gotta some interesting info out of it." she looked over the symbols as she mumbled under her breath before answering him "Yeah the lecherous captain is fine. He sends me notes every time he comes by the ship. He knows I get bored and my mind needs distractions so he give me puzzles to solve. This one is a code. From what I deciphered so far he is looking for some recruits a mission. Looks like some kind of interception. Theres just these few damn symbols I don't understand."
zzo 10-Oct-19 10:41 AM
The persistent warmth of Namira's frame nestled next to his felt surreal, like he were at the point between sleeping and waking. Every word she spoke was a silver bell...but what was this? As Namira's pulled away, the feeling of her fingertips lingering on the scales of his neck, Tsuzuto regains some lucidity and hones his focus on the content of her beautiful voice. "I am somehow reluctant to believe there is anything your curious mind cannot comprehend, Nami-tan." He smiles at her, felt like his insides were sloshing about, as though he were a bag of water rolling down a hill, then looks down at the note. "...I don't suppose I could offer my assistance? It would be my most emphatic pleasure to be of service."
NervousNoobz 10-Oct-19 11:07 AM
Namira looked up at him with a raised brow. One of her ears falling down as the other perked up. The symbols where something he would probably definitely be much more familiar with. But would be be able to decipher it? A slave go her curiosity she opened up the paper full and turned around, leaned her beck against him so he could see the paper clearly by looking over her shoulders. She brought her fingers up to a point on the page that displayed what looked to be symbols of various flowers and plants she did not recognize and surprisingly enough what appeared to be some druidic symbols. Wanting to give Namira a challenge the captain purposely added things even her mind would have trouble with do to her lack of knowledge about nature "What do you think.?"
zzo 10-Oct-19 11:29 AM
The press. Her back sliding into his chest; Tsuzuto feels his abdomen tighten, his breath catch, and a wave of tingles courses up his neck...exhilerating. He would draw a deep breath, exhale slowly, and steal another feel of her by way of resting his chin near her warm and fuzzy ear. "Hmm..." Tsuzuto summons his focus, and follows her finger to the symbol she indicated... "I see your problem right away Nami-tan~" He says through a toothy smile, then leans his arm over Namira's shoulder, sleeve drawing back to reveal most of his scaly forearm, and puts his own finger near hers. "These are the marks of the wardens of nature, most know it as being called, druidic." His head moves up, and he looks down at Namira, taking in her cherubic profile. He paints a mental portrait of this view as well, then locks it away with the others for safekeeping. "I am quite surprised you do not know this already~" (edited)
NervousNoobz 04-Nov-19 11:31 AM
Namira's eyes drifting to the scales long his forearm for a moment running her fingers up his arms curiously, to feel the texture of his scales. He was an interesting humanoid creature. She wondered again how much of him was more serpentine and how much was human. When he mentioned his surprise at her lack of knowledge she looked up at him and shrugged "its not like I haven't tried. Druids are really secretive about There language for some reasons. So you know what they say??" she asked with a more excitable voice.
@zzo
zzo 04-Nov-19 11:39 AM
It took a moment for Tsuzuto to release his own bottom lip; the instant Nami's finger had trailed along it had made him bite down. The warmth of her fingertip permeated his scales and sent quite the notable shiver through him. Once he had taken the split second to compose himself, he would say, "This is nothing to be ashamed of Nami-tan~ I would be more than happy to exchange knowledge with you." As if he wouldn't have given it to her freely. He would have of course, but no one likes a pushover; at least that's what father had always said...Namira's eyes cut him to the quick, though she likely hadn't intended such an effect. It made him blush regardless, her and that enchanting excitement she showed. "Let's see," He says, readjusting slightly, leaning over her shoulder just a bit to get a closer view. Of course, her wonderful aroma was only slightly distracting, but he would give her the best insight he could to discern the druidic symbols.
zzo 04-Nov-19 11:48 AM
Some few moments later, the red in Tsuzuto's eyes becomes visible, his surprise now plainly evident. He looks to Nami once, then back to the paper to double check. What he'd seen was definitely correct however, and so he related to her: "This--is not a word I see often, Nami-tan...The Captain makes mention here of a weapon, in the possession of--the Silver Knights?...If I am not mistaken, he means to say it is for--an imminent conflict, with the demons and devils coming to this plane..." Tsuzuto scratches his head, a bit perplexed, never having met a devil, nor a demon before. Or a silver knight, for that matter. "Do these words spark recognition for you, Nami-tan?" he asks, watching her beautiful face after. (edited)
NervousNoobz 04-Nov-19 12:40 PM
Namira's eyes widen as she looked up at Zzo impressed with his ability to decipher the text and actually help her with something. When he spoke what the words said Namira snapped her fingers "Of course! thats what it is! good word Tsu" she moved away from his chest and quickly began to write out the message again but in common. After she was done she turned back towards tsu and shoved the paper into his face. There was a brightness about her that she didn't show often. Like solving this puzzle was a spark the ignited a fire in her. It was clear how much Namira enjoyed stimulating her mind and finding figuring out mysteries 'It's an invite on to his ship! for a job to intercept a Silver Knights ship! We're going to do this. Namira said boldly bringing Tsu into if even though she just met him
@zzo
zzo 04-Nov-19 12:57 PM
Blink blink...Tsuzuto could smell the paper as Nami held it close, could smell the ink too even. He read it, of course, as he was certain she'd wanted him to, and thought for a moment. She would see the tip of his index finger on top of the page, which would gently give a tug downward so that he could see her light up the room with her smile. "Nami-tan...are you quite sure...?" his face flushes again, which he hadn't planned on; these kinds of things just happen. "I may be somewhat familiar with the good Captain, but I would not want to--obstruct.." He swallows a hard lump in his throat. Was she sincere? Could he really have gotten so lucky in such a short span of time? Tsuzuto could hardly believe it, but only a fool could decline. Gods, but she was so bright, it was all he could do to keep from turning away, a quivering mass. "If you would have me, it would be my most distinct and privileged honor to accompany you."
NervousNoobz 04-Nov-19 01:07 PM
Namira pulled the parchment from his face and folded it up placing it into one of her pouches. Before looking back at Tsuzuto with an inguisitive look. "What do you mean am i sure? I never say anything without being sure of my words. That would be foolish of me if i did otherwises. Besides you are my assistant after all" Namira stated very nonchalantly as if this was common knowledge. She then realized what she had done. Namira often said things in her mind that she thought she said out loud. Which made her sometimes talk in mid sentence or assume someone would know something when she never actually told them. "Oh did i not say that out loud? well I know most things, i am smarter then most but you have intellect in areas i lack. Logically that makes you very useful assistant"
@zzo
zzo 04-Nov-19 01:17 PM
Tsuzuto was veritably full to bursting with pride at her sudden words. Assistant! This was many steps beyond merely being an acquaintance; thankfully he'd eaten this morning, otherwise the sheer rush of blood to his face would have had him fainting on the spot. Instinctively, his hands move out to clasp around hers, head lowered to show his gratefulness. "Thank you, Nami-tan... I have never known that I-- could feel so happy!" His head rises back up to show his tight-lipped smile going ear to ear, and he would release her hands, surprised he'd even been so bold as all that. "You have my word that I will strive in this endeavor for as long as I draw breath."
NervousNoobz 13-Nov-19 12:46 PM
Namira awkwardly looked down at her hands then back up at Tsuzuto. His hands once again where surprisingly warm considering what he was "Um...sure no problem." When he released her hand she continued to look down at her hands for a second before putting them in the pocket. "Alright yelp lets get started." Namira grabbed Tsuzuto's wrist and dragged him off towards her lab/room in Ryder's shop
#namira-lab-room
zzo 13-Nov-19 01:14 PM
It would go without question that Tsuzuto would follow without a fuss. His head was still swimming, if he were being honest; a goofy smile had overpowered his usual stoic grace as he was dragged off. "I am readyyyy--!" His voice trails off as the door clicks shut behind them. Exit

zzo 29-Nov-19 10:37 AM
Heavy footsteps thump outside of the door to the bar lounge, a muffled "Oh hey, long time no s--" starts cheerily but tails off, rather falls away. A heavy sigh, and then the door opens; in comes Gorou. The big red dragonborn rubbed tiredly at the back of his neck, "eyebrows" furrowed in deep, but likely ineffective thought. His nostrils work unbidden, drawing in the scents of the room he'd entered. The whiff of alcohol pulls him from his reverie, and he looks up to see the scene. "Oh! Maybe not so unlucky after all...!" he exclaims, at a modest volume, then notes a familiar beak. "Allo there!" he cheerily says to Pox, and would go to stand a seat or so from her at the bar. One of his arms would test the bar stool with a good portion of his leaning weight; likely, this has been a habit learned from many prior incidents... "Good to see ya made it up here after all! Been feeling okay since--ya know, the thing?"
ShwiggityShwah 29-Nov-19 10:41 AM
Its mouth is open, eyes rolling back into its head, it seems like there three snakes or worms coming out of its mouth in order to lap up as much of the whiskey in the glass as it can. The voice breaks it out of its trance. He bops a little, its feet barely touching the ground. "Oh! Hi hi friend!" still that odd way of speaking. "Yes yes yes." It nodded. "Got some sleep... got some drink. Much better. Might need more drink. Drink with Pox. Things get less fuzzy with the drink."
zzo 29-Nov-19 10:49 AM
"...I'll drink to that, yea?" Now that he'd gotten a bit closer, there definitely was something unique about the way Pox had been drinking. He figured it were probably his head playing tricks on him, a common occurrence. So he turns and does as recommended. "I'll have uhhhh--just an ale. A big one, please." he asks of the big guy behind the bar, then as he waits for (and possibly receives) the drink, he would turn to Pox with a smile and offer, "None of that wine stuff for me, I swore it off after last time." He gives a toothy grin and would raise a friendly toast when the ale came. "Here's to a little less fuzz, yea?" (edited)
ShwiggityShwah 29-Nov-19 03:57 PM
"Big one! More fire!" It held out its glass excited. The orc seemed a little disturbed but obliged them their drinks. "Names Max." "Names Max." Pox repeated in the same way. zzo 29-Nov-19 04:55 PM
"I couldn't tell ya even if ya asked me--" he extols in reply, and follows suit, taking out around half the mug in a few solid swigs. The mug goes back to the counter, and Gorou licks away the brew mustache before cautiously settling onto a bar chair...it creaks, perhaps in pain, but otherwise didn't seem any worse for the wear. "And thank you, Max." he raised the mug to the bartender; he'd be sure to leave a good tip. Gorou gingerly rests his forearm onto the bar, and leans on it, looking back to his one time quest companion. "So you don't mind that? Folks thinking you're creepy? I like the way ya talk miss Pox. It's--special?" he nods after processing what little vocabulary he had at his disposal, it would hopefully suffice. "...Kinda~ feel like you were taller when I first saw ya though."
ShwiggityShwah 29-Nov-19 06:55 PM
"Pox is Pox. Can't change Pox. Don't know how. " It sipped at its drink, the burn in its throat again. "Pox seen things. Might have lost lost lost Bwaaak, lost my mind." It shrugs, the feathers getting ruffled. "Kenku. Kenku steal. Steal everything. How to do things. How to say things. Nothing original. All forged. All copies. Sorry friend. Pox nice- just... creepy." Pox nods to that. "Kenku is problem. Missing something. Pox try alchemy. Pox try potion." It puts one on the counter. "Sometimes Pox grow, sometimes shrink. Sometimes, strange things."
zzo 29-Nov-19 07:12 PM
The mug of ale went up and down from Gorou's mouth several times during the explanation, his face drawn in consternation. Although Pox' brief squawk of an outburst forced a smirk out of him against his wishes, other words drew out a sort of sympathetic look...then out comes the potion. He took visual measure of the thing. What color it was, the glint of the light off the vial, and after a few moments was able to piece together this business of alchemy was to Pox what masonry used to be to him. A proverbial building won't stand without a proverbial keystone. "Wow~ Shrink, grow, and--strange things..." he ponders breathily as he looks at the potion, visibly impressed. Then looks back up to Pox. "So this does all those things, but ya still think you're missing something... You must be after something pretty special, yea?" (edited)
ShwiggityShwah 30-Nov-19 12:51 AM
Pretty gnarly. But-
The question made the kenku stop smiling. It pushed its glass away as it turned its stool to face him. It opened its mouth to speak but then merely shoved itself off the stool.
It held out its arms and opened its mouth. A womans voice spoke out.
Once, the Kenku held wing in their wings, embracing the gusty sky and singing the sweet language of birdsong. Serving a master whose identity is now lost to their memory, the kenku coveted the glittering baubles of his household, and long to speak so that they could cajole and swindle others out of such treasures. For their greed and their corruption. The Gods loathed them as vermin. Vermin should not fly, so they took our wings, grounding us forever in the muck and dirt. Vermin do not create, so they took our spark of imagination. All we have is what we steal. Vermin do not speak, and finally they took our voices, so we could never beg for forgiveness.
zzo 30-Nov-19 08:41 AM
It certainly was an interesting looking potion...but Pox's sudden turn into this eerie presentation wrenched away his attention from the bottle. He couldn't even bring himself to drink as he listened wide-eyed to the tale, mouth agape and growing agaper...when the tale closed on a somber note, Gorou looked stricken with a mix of indignance and sympathy over the plight of, apparently not just Pox, but all Kenku. "That's...That's..." he fumbles, trying in vain to verbalize what Pox likely already knew. "Well that's just bloody awful! I'm so sorry miss Pox; you really are after something special..." He half wondered if she were in need of a hug, with her arms out like that. It was a really sad story...but there was that thing with the gods too... "Ya know, I met some church people not long ago, though most of em only talked about one god--goddess," he corrects himself on the fly, "I dunno much about gods and curses and all that, but they seem really--really nice, actually... I wonder if they'd be able to help? Because it sounds like you're doing some really big things here, and if it were me, I'd have definitely lost my marbles by now. You should be proud..." Gorou went on at length, hopefully dropping some useful information that he'd gathered and processed best he could. Then he would try to discern the emotional state of Pox; if it seemed appropriate, he would ask with a friendly smile, "Need a hug? Always makes me feel better."
ShwiggityShwah 30-Nov-19 07:36 PM
Pox smiled and shrugged. "Not my fault. Not my brother or sister or egg's fff-" 'she' stopped. There was a moment she stopped- just staring straight ahead as if in a trance.... one of her green eyes beginning to drift as if something was trying to push out through the eye, but she makes a sound and just shakes her head. "Fault-. She looks at him as she hops back onto her stool. "Grrrrg. Not sure. Gods fault. Pox don't trust gods... Not all gods bad, but know things, bad things. Makes it hard for Pox. Guess, its worth it. Pox was scholar. Scholar before hunter. Pox read. Pox read lots. Other Kenku tried. Still trying. Only- only thing worth trying for... or you try be rich. Or try to survive." Pox turned her beak to him when the dragonborne suggested a hug. "Grrrr?" It made a noise and looked to him. "You want hug? Want Pox as mate?" Difficult culture maybe. "Oh wait. Hug is arms. Don't want to hug Pox. Pox covered in goo."
zzo 01-Dec-19 01:59 AM
"Ehehe," laughed the dragonborn bashfully, "Yea, hugs is arms...but I'm still gonna ask, goo? How'd ya wind up covered in goo?" Sometimes a guy like him had a bit of time keeping on track with the finer points of a conversation. As far as he could tell though, this was clearly a resourceful creature that knows what it wants, just not how to get it. "And that's another thing, I've heard quite a few people aren't really fond of these gods in the last couple hours...Didn't seem so bad to me, but that story of yours may have just changed my mind." Gorou picks up the mug once again, and drains it down, up and up until it were empty, then sets it down. "Then again I'm pretty quick to forgive..." (edited)
ShwiggityShwah 01-Dec-19 02:03 PM

zzo 01-Dec-19 06:08 PM

"But you're right, everybody there in that chapel was real friendly right away, and smart...helpful... We're friends, right Pox? We popped that nasty sucker back at the farm but good, yea?"

zzo 02-Dec-19 01:23 PM
After such and such a time of straightening up, Gorou found himself with a lack of mess to clean. He was used to this kind of thing; always preferring to keep his own spaces tidy. Gorou would cast about the lounge with his hands on his hips, and give a nod of approval. He would approach the bar once more near Takeshi, and start counting up some gratuity for Max. "Got half a mind to hit the bath myself," Gorou says tiredly to Takeshi and he clicks some coin in his coin purse. "Two big ol' scuffles like that in just as many hours is...well, ya know..." Three gold pieces are placed in a stack on the counter, and slid forward. "Sorry for all the trouble," he says to Max, then looks to Takeshi. "Ya wanna come along? Heard it's nice, yea?"

zzo 12-Dec-19 04:56 PM
The door to the bar lounge clicks open and swings wide with a squeak. In through the portal steps a moderately tall and green fellow, garbed in a black fur coat. Zzo'olo would pass a noncommittal nod to any others present, keeping his eyes to the floor, then go to sit at the bar. He orders something strong, then would pull a gold ring from his pocket, spins it idly on the counter in thought, and watches it tumble to a stop before taking a drink of the spirits. (edited)

zzo 12-Dec-19 05:24 PM
Big Bear Skin at the bar had spun the ring once again. It whirled about, pushing sound out from the wood of the bar counter. But then came a voice, familiar, and it knew his name. He first would make a short glance over his shoulder, and then double-takes himself; turns about face in the stool, and the ring clatters to a stop once again during the long moments of recognition. Zzo'olo blinks, lips parted, stunned. "...You came after all...?" he breaths, the disbelief plain on his toothy face. (edited)

ShwiggityShwah 12-Dec-19 11:27 PM
And as Keena made some new friend, Phoenix Dawn, with all of his perfect radiant glory, returned, bestowing on the group a repaste of fruity cocktails for the ladies and some stronger smelling whiskey for the men. Somehow he managed to balance four glasses as he walked. "Ladies and gents, Phoenix Dawn is here to save this party and-" Zzo was there. "Blast it all! Hah! I should have brought a spare!" He said, his voice mighty, deep, heroic. "To you Lady Keena. Pendragon, love the name. Miss Nova! Do not let my divinity perturb you. Phoenix Dawn is friend and hero to all, especially women, and especially ESPECIALLY! Members of the most Glorious Steel Hearts! You may know me as Phoenix Dawn! Hammer of Dawn! Pillar of Justice!"
NervousNoobz 12-Dec-19 11:50 PM
Nova seemed quiet unphased by the over the top theatrics of the radiant Aasimar as he returned with drinks for everyone. She giggled when he seemed upset at not having a drink for Zzo. "It's alright Mr. Dawn! Zzo can have my drink. My kind can get satiated plenty with just being in the presence of other. And I must say your particular enthusiastic temperament is quiet the mouth full for a succubus like me." she rubbed her belly and chuckled again. As she dragged Zzo along and sat him down on one of the seats next to her before placing her drink infront of him. Not taking into account the fruity cocktail looked amusingly out of place being infront of the large looming serpentine warrior. Nova then looked back up towards Dawn and smiled brightly. Her dim glowing skin seeming to brighten just slightly more
"Don't be silly Mr. Dawn! I am ecstatic to be in the presence of Aasimar again! It has been so long. I may not look it but half of my lineage is that of Aasmir folk. And please forgive me, I have only just recently returned to the material plane so I am not familiar with who you are, but! If you are anything like the heroic Zzo!" she said placing a hand on his shoulder "Or any of the other wonderful members I met so far" she placed her other hand on Penn's shoulder "Then I am sure you are as glorious as you say!" Nova own form of radiance and enthusiasm seem to almost compare to his (edited)

ShwiggityShwah 13-Dec-19 12:06 AM
"Are you sure?" He asked, "I could be louder?" He laughed. Truly odd that a succubus and a aasimar could be so easy to collude. "Indeed." He bid her a look before sitting next to Keena, the girl he had entered with. "We are truly rare, but a mix of celestial and infernal- the result being such a joyous and darling treasure such as yourself, well, its no wonder Sune and Asmodeus had fallen in such love." He stuck his barrel chest out and feigned man tears. "Warms my heart. Aye, I'd be happy to share the stories of my many victories if I might hear of yours?" This he actually looked to everyone, his glass raised. "How about it? We don't leave this table until we are comrades at arms! A toast to the HEROES OF PEACE JUSTICE AND VICTORY!"
NervousNoobz 13-Dec-19 12:18 AM
Nova let out a dreamy sigh as she placed her hands on her cheeks and stared off into the distance almost daydreaming "It is a wondrous thing isn't it! The love between Asmodeus and Sune" sigh and smiles "To defy all odds in the name of passion and love! So beautiful. Just as my mother and father did. I can only hope to find a love like that myself one-day" she said as she cupped her hands over her heart. He eyes filled with romanticized daydreams. Before she brought herself back to the room. She clapped her hands excitedly at the notion "CHEERS!"When Dawn mentioned victories Nova seemed a bit bashful* "Well I am still quiet new to the adventuring side of things. I have had many small victories of helping other fiends legally make there way to this plane and one very exciting victory protecting the prophets of the church that my friend Zzo here actually aided in! But I'm afraid my list of stories is not very impressive. What about you all! I'd love to hear more about the Steel hearts!"

zzo 13-Dec-19 01:12 AM
There were a scant few times Zzo'olo had been so indelibly preoccupied...The sheer bafflement plastered onto his face withstood the test of time, as Nova wrangled him this way and that. His eyes were brazenly fixated on her, only her. Were there other people? In his mind there was still the weighty possibility he may just be dreaming again...at least the damn dino wasn't in this one. Drinks went undrank; the glass of spirits on the bar, and the fruity facsimile of a beverage alike. The world for him, despite all the glowing celestials about, had gone dark, save for that pastel lavender face and enthralling smile. "...I didn't think I'd see ya again." The chalky, bassy voice croaks out in stark contrast to the other various dulcetones at the table. Even sounding the way he did, looking the way he did, wave after wave of adulating, albeit restrained emotions would smack into Nova. Not unlike a dog whose master had returned from a long, long absence.

Cap'n 13-Dec-19 04:09 PM

ShwiggityShwah 13-Dec-19 04:27 PM
He took a moment to consider, giving a bit of drink before he looked back to her, keeping his voice low. "People are going to treat you different." He said. A surprising amount of restraint and contemplation in his voice as he explained. "If thats the case, you have to try hard to break the mold. You have to constantly remind them that you're nothing to be afraid of. That you're just like them. You want to belong. Love. Understanding. You do it so much, you have to learn to love it yourself. You become that shining example of what you hope they see in you. Its why I smile, I yell, and I fight. So hopefully I get a smile back."

NervousNoobz 16-Dec-19 10:03 AM
As Nova chatted with Dawn, there enthusiastic bantering most certainly the loudest in the bar she could feel the various auras radiating off of her present company. Possitive emotions coming from all directions and..a very strong aura of wonder and longing. She wasn't sure who was giving off such a delightful and delicious aura till Penn and Keena wondered off on there own for a moment. "I didnt think id see ya again she heard Zzo deep voice say next to her as she looked over to him. That is when she realized the aura was coming off of him..by why she wondered. She gave him a warm smile "I am happy to see you again too Zzo, after what us and the others went through and how wonderful you all where i knewi had to see the Steel hearts first hand"
zzo 16-Dec-19 10:34 AM
Had a hundred years really passed since then? Zzo'olo often kept to the notion that his memory wasn't the best in the world, parcularly when it came to his poorer showings... Never could remember a flubbed match, or being charred by manticore fire, or losing a chariot wheel while being chased about some coliseum or other by--well, you get the idea. This woman here though; the sight of her cherubic smile brought floods of memories rushing back. It was definitely a poor showing...he was surprised she'd even remembered him, but it wasn't as visible on his inscrutable face as it was in his emotional aura. He nods to her reply. "...'S good ta see yer injuries 'aven't lingered." he says hesitantly, an unbidden callback to her long-passed skewering at the hands of the cold rider. "Wat've ya been doin since then? Still an ambassador?" he leans onto the table with his elbow, dodging the fruity drink.
NervousNoobz 16-Dec-19 10:54 AM
When he mentioned her injuries Nova placed a hand over her stomach where she was skewered. She could always feel the reminants of the overwhelming pain she has felt from the attack. Not something she enjoyed reminiscing about but then again it reminded her how lucky she was "Oh thank you! Yes it was quite the blow but I manage to heal most of the damage. Although" she hooked her fingers around the the edge of her form fitting clothing and pulled it to the side to reveal a small inch scar where she was impaled. "There is a little bit of lingering. But I think it makes me look tougher don't you think hehe" she said with a giggle and she poked her scar that was the only small almost unnoticeable flaw in an otherwise perfect form. His other question made her smile brightly. "Yes i am and it's wonderful! Meeting all the fiends who desire to enter this plane and being able to assist them in coming here legally makes me so happy. I have a character witness for a few now"
zzo 16-Dec-19 11:29 AM
The scar Nova put out for display hits Zzo'olo with a mixture of emotions that brings a single twitch to his eye, and a burning flush of hot onto his face. She was right though; his own scars often acted as testament, and were even precious. It looked good on her, of course...still, he could have, should have prevented it. "Ya got 'ere jus' in time then, eh? Word aboard the ship says there was some kinda incident long those lines in tha medicine ward not long ago."
NervousNoobz 16-Dec-19 11:46 AM
A curious look came acrossed her face as when Zzo mentioned an incident in the medicine ward "Oh? What Kind of incident exactly??"
zzo 16-Dec-19 12:19 PM
"Well, from wat I 'eard," Zzo'olo begins his reply, chair noisily groaning as he takes a couple scoots closer to her, "This big bugger of a fiend took some lady, then tossed tha place but good. My memory's a litt'le fuzzy afta that...probly went fine." (edited)

zzo 20-Dec-19 06:33 PM
Zzo'olo hadn't been anticipating such a chance meeting to happen. He'd been all but certain he was enduring divine punishment, but ever since he'd gotten started, there was little room for pause. He talked at length about several goings in that he'd caught wind of, questioning her about her journey up to the Steel Heart and so on. It was the most he'd talked in a while. "--an' eva since then, I been thinkin 'bout doin some readin on it, but 'oo am I kiddin, right? I'm lucky enough t' be able ta read the map o' this big bloody ship--ya know wat?" Zzo'olo abruptly halts his eager rambling and stands, the chair groans noisily as it scoots back. He extends a hand down to Nova. "Does me litt'le good tellin ya. Lemme show ya about instead." he gives her an unavoidably toothy smile, zealous in his fixation and altogether neverminding his surroundings. "--Or I could jus' carry ya, iffin yer used to it?" Smile becomes smirk. (edited)
NervousNoobz 21-Dec-19 11:45 AM
Nova hands cupped her chin as it rested in her palm so hee face was propped up by her elbows while she listened intently to Zzo rambling. "Oh if you would like I can teach you how to read more then just maps" she offered happily before watching the large serpentine man stand back up. She blushed a bit and giggled at his offer to carry her. "That's very sweet of you but I'm honestly not very used to being carried. Although I dress quite eloquent I am not used to such things. You learn to survive when living in the abyss" That being said Nova still places her small delicate hand in Zzo's massive olive palms and stood up as well. She looked over to Penn not wanting to be rude and leaving him after he offered to show her around. But as she looked to them she noticed ans felt the pleased aura coming from Keena and Penn. They seemed to be enjoying each others company. Nova smiled when Penn was telling Penn he has to go to show her around and he would hear a voice in his head "Why don't you stay here and keep Keena company. She seems to enjoy it. I can have one of these gentleman so me around instead. And May be we can meet up another time.hmm?" (edited)
ShwiggityShwah 22-Dec-19 09:01 AM
"Please!" Dawn stands up and puts his hands on his chest. He has been told before not to interrupt numerous times before by everyone, and thus he needed to make the new comers feel welcome. He was proud of himself, sitting and listening to the exchanges around him. He was the humble of holy knights to the sun god. Truly he must be happy. Much to his annoyance Keena and Penn seem to be getting along, but such is the way of things. Nova and Zzo also seemed to be getting close and when it was suggested for a tour, he volunteered. Perhaps it was his musing that could better make the experience for them both. "Allow me to show you love birds around this great and vast home. There are truly wonders here!"

zzo 23-Dec-19 11:23 AM
Zzo'olo blinked as he felt the sleeve of his coat go snug around one arm; Nova's hand was recognized a moment later, then the rest of the world at large. Where in the nine did all these other people come from, he thought as he snapped from his reverie. The shiniest one among them was looking them down, tall. The Lizard Brain takes over for a moment and starts up a deep, hissing noise in Zzo'olo's chest. "...where to first, Dawn?..." His ears had ceased ringing long enough to catch the tail end of Nova's words, and he catches himself in turn. He weren't the most perceptive demi-human around, but she seemed happy. Flashbacks of the recent job ensue, and forces his mind back to passive normalcy. The gods' tests knew no limits. Even still, Zzo'olo would be sure to grab up the ring on the bar he'd be playing with from before and stuff it into a pocket before they left... (edited)

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 03-Apr-20 11:41 AM
Hal quietly and cautiously entered the establishment, her blue eyes noting the swirling shadowy image. The bar was like most sheâ€™d seen during her years as a spy for the Phiarlan matriarch. When she saw where Garg was sitting, she took her seat next to him, one palm splayed on the table, while the other raked through her fiery hair. â€œMead, thanks,â€ Hal said to whoever was serving the drinks. She then smiled and waited for her order to arrive. It was a sweeter drink, probably a bit dangerous to go for so soon. After all, sheâ€™d only just eaten, her meal before that a day ago. Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 24-Apr-20 02:06 AM
(from #lonehunters-room )
Uthal soon found himself in a part of the ship he'd seen in other towns, his heavy footsteps likely signaling his entrance into the bar; a place where they served alcohol of all kinds, and it looked like this place was no different. There were a couple of others, but they seemed to be in the middle of a conversation, so he decided not to interrupt them. There seemed to be a dwarf as well, and judging by the stern expression and the fact he was behind the row of seasoned and shining wood, he was likely the one in charge. A good choice; Dwarves knew their drink well. As such he looked around, seeing the relative splendor of the place despite it being fairly small; this guild must do very well for themselves if they can afford such luxuries, he thought. Could mean they fought strong monsters to collect such bounties...His massive form shivered at the prospect; not out of fear, no, but out of excitement. A small smile crossed his face as he pounded his massive fists together, the sound echoing across the room. (edited)
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 24-Apr-20 12:20 PM
Irithriel had woken up rather refreshed from her sleep, leaving a note with her Mors before readying herself for the day. She kissed his lips and then looked at herself in the mirror. Satisfied with her appearance, once more donning one of her sheer lacy nightdresses that Mors loved to hate. Or was it hated to love? Oh, it didnâ€™t matter. She knew he liked them in his way and that was enough. Humming softly, Iri exited their bedroom and closed the door. With a slight skip to her step, the pretty elf made her way down the corridor. She glanced down at her belly, one hand moving to touch it. She smiled then, dreaming of the son she and Mors would soon have. â€œLalala....â€ Iri sang aloud, the melody quite pleasant to the ear. Suddenly, she stopped and peeked inside the bar. Her gray eyes locked onto the newcomer. A goliath! Just like her Mors! She giggled then and made her way towards him. â€œGood morning, sir,â€ Iri greeted, giving the newcomer that curtsy sheâ€™d been trained to give since birth. â€œI donâ€™t think Iâ€™ve had the pleasure. Iâ€™m Irithriel Ravenwood. Though please, call me Iri.â€ At that, she sat down, her cheeks rosy and bright. She was excited to meet yet another like her beast. Perhaps the two could be friends.
( @Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi )
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 24-Apr-20 12:40 PM
Uthal was busy looking around when he heard singing...And then a voice. He turned around, not seeing anyone at first, but then looked down and saw a smaller elf peering up at him, curtsying as many of their kind did. "I am new here. My name is Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi, but you may refer to me as Lonehunter." he would say, giving her a small bow of the head, his black eyes gazing down upon her. He was neutral, not condescending nor favorable, but he would speak in a level tone towards her. However, he did notice the bump in her belly, and a small smile crossed his stony-featured face. "Congratulations" he would then say, motioning with a hand to her bump, adding "The carving of a new life is to always be celebrated."
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 24-Apr-20 12:57 PM
Iri immediately felt her face grow hot, the girl shifting a little in her seat. She brought her hand back to her belly and gave it a gentle rub. With a soft giggle, she then nodded and looked back up into the Goliathâ€™s eyes. â€œWhy thank you, Mr Lonehunter,â€ Iri said sweetly. A part of her was utterly elated another could tell her condition just by looking at her. How she longed to meet her son! For Mors to become a father. The three of them... a family. â€œWe are quite happy to start our new family.â€ Just then, Iri bit down on her lip and leaned against the table. Her eyes scanned Lonehunter for a moment. Yes, heâ€™d make a wonderful companion for her beast. â€œYouâ€™ll have to meet my beast,â€ she went on. â€œI mean... my Mors.â€ Her face darkened even more. â€œMy mate is a goliath just like you. Iâ€™d love for the two of you to meet.â€
Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 24-Apr-20 09:03 PM
"No 'Mister', please. Just Lonehunter will suffice." he would reply; he knew she was just being polite, but prefixes in names always bothered him. Far too restrictive; why cultures felt a need to include such things in names always confused him. But then, Goliaths rarely were ever part of 'polite society'. And though he had no visible eyebrows, she would see the muscle raise in the attempt; her beast? And then she went on to explain what it meant, making Uthal chuckle slightly. A deep rumble that came from the bottom of his massive barrel chest, but still just a slight chuckle; one could only imagine how loud he'd be if he were to actually laugh. "I would like that as well. I was actually looking for the one called Mors; Guild Master Cassius had said other Goliaths joined this crew." Giving his chin a bit of a stroke, he then eyed her contemplatively before speaking once more. "I am surprised, I must say; I had been under the impression Elves were rather delicate. You must be quite resilient to endure being a Goliath's mate." he would then say, no shame in an otherwise unflattering statement.
Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 24-Apr-20 10:14 PM
â€œLonehunter it is then,â€ Iri stated happily. â€œI do think my Mors would do well to have more goliath friends.â€ The pretty elf frowned, her lower lip sticking out. â€œMy beast seems sad sometimes. I know he adores my company, but my beast needs to let his true nature flow freely and without care. He needs others he can test himself against, push his limits.â€ Iriâ€™s smile grew, her hand idly rubbing her belly â€œI do train with my beast, Lonehunter,â€ she went on to explain. â€œIâ€™ve even conquered him twice...â€ The girlâ€™s voice trailed then and she let Uthal decide what that actually meant. Meanwhile, the blood rose to her cheeks and she giggled. â€œDelicate?â€ Iri echoed, a finger moving to play with her snowy white tresses. â€œWell, my Mors might have other opinions there. Thereâ€™s a reason I call him my beast.â€ The girl sat back, situating herself. â€œTell me, Lonehunter. What do you think of human fairytales?â€ She looked up at Uthal with wide, expressive eyes, thoroughly enjoying his company.

He gave me the name of the head of new new gang the light foot clan and, the location that he would be in a few nights. He puases for a moment to take another sip of his cocktail before continuing to sign to thrin. I had a few people help me out with the altercation. 005 and 027 a tabaxi and kenku respecteding. So anyways we get to the spot and what do you know the fucking guy is there with a god damned army of people and beasts. The three of us damn near wet our self's at the sight of so many armed hostiles. That was untill our guy's guy had shown up with a cage with a trap on it a top a wagon. Things got heated between the two yelling some stuff in Draconic along of lines of "you ass hole! We agreed on 1,000 gold for the fucking beast!" And ",Two fucking bad I have a buyer who offered me two times that amount pluse a bounes if I get it too him with in the next week. So 2,500 right the fuck now or were leaving."

Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 26-Apr-20 07:29 PM
"Goliaths pride themselves on individual achievements, for sure, but it is the strength of their family and allies that truly drives them to do great things. I would be honored to count myself among your husband's allies. To build the great mountain that will shatter our enemies. And if he wishes to test himself, I would welcome the opportunity to spar with another stone-brother." he would reply to her. But again, she surprised him with her comments, making a low chuckle leave him yet again. "Is that so? He must be very happy with you to allow that to happen." he would say, the remark not getting by him; Goliaths talked and did everything they could to prove there was no obstacle they could not conquer. One Goliath in the Katho-Olavi even promised he would get a wife from every known species...And he was never seen again after that. Uthal did not know what happened to him, but hoped he would succeed in that endeavor. Every rock faced its own trials, and if this was fate had him do, then so by the Mother Stone it would be done. "I admit, I've not read much; I've heard of tales of human knights conquering beasts like dragons. If that was the person best for the role of slaying the beast, then they chose well." he would say, somewhat missing the point of her question.

Uthal Lonehunter Katho-Olavi 27-Apr-20 11:58 AM

Warden - Nathan - Alor 27-Apr-20 12:24 PM
Warden had been on his own mission for a few weeks now. Taking time to come to conclusion that he, Barry, and Phantom were going to stay. He knew that his last mission was one of those bad batches ones that didnt pan out as plan. Be had left to be in the forest to meditate in his own way. Returning with hides and other things from nature he would need in due time he eventually falls into the lounge. Phantom bounding next to him with a slightly larger Bary on his head. The tail now falling past the pups ears and resting on the neck. Phantom still couldnt be bothered. Looking around he sees no one. Grunting and making his way to the far corner. He lays down his pack by a chair and sits down in it. The wood creaking under him he shifted his weight as to not break the first chair he sees. With a heavy sigh he lays his head back. Phantom and Bary take post next to him. Realizing the smell of the booze makes it very hard for him to rest he remembers there is a second lounge. Taking his gear he heads that way to find some rest. He somehow didnt want to go to the gardens just yet. (Exit to #lounge ) (edited)

She entered quietly, her thigh length coat trailing behind her as she moved. Pressing her thick rimmed glasses up on the bridge of her nose she scanned the room and noticed the Kalishtar woman. Taking particular note of her, 'casual dress', she approached and cleared her throat. "Well met, companion." Her tone is soft and even, but holds a slightly sweet note.

Ford looks up at the woman and polymorphs a mouth to smile as he extends a hand to shake hers. With his off hand he pulls out a deck of cards and pulls out a card with writing on it. It reads "Hi my name is Ford. I don't talk much but I like to think I'm good company. Anyways it's nice to meet you!"
Jad (: (Armi, Kalas, Volya) 06-May-20 01:03 PM

impulsive ram 06-May-20 01:18 PM

Jad (: (Armi, Kalas, Volya) 06-May-20 01:22 PM
she grabs a sketchbook size paper pad and some pens, before flipping through some calligraphy to an empty page and handing it to Ford "This might be a bit easier. Don't ya think?" She says with a wink "Sorry about the calligraphy, it's just some practice. Now, what kind of person are you?"
impulsive ram 06-May-20 01:33 PM
Ford asks the bar tender for a spoon and takes some the ice from his drink and cracks it. He then takes the note pad and pen and starts to write. "Well that's the ice broken. I like puns, having fun, and fighting. I also grow up on a farm. How about your self miss?"
Jad (: (Armi, Kalas, Volya) 06-May-20 01:38 PM
she facepalms with a smile "We are going to get along great. I enjoy long walks on the beach, drink more than I should, and love learning new ways to fight." She finishes her drink "I grew up in a nice, mostly quiet little town. Nothing really special. Well, until I left."
impulsive ram 06-May-20 01:58 PM
"what happened after you left?" He writes then takes another sip of his drink.
Jad (: (Armi, Kalas, Volya) 06-May-20 02:06 PM
"Well, nothing to the city luckily...but my life got much different. Before I left, Master Minato gave me enough supplies to make my way wherever I wanted. I traveled for seven years, trying to help people out. I saw way too many people living terrible lives, cities burning, families destroyed. I tried to help them out, but I wasn't strong enough. I traveled into the mountains, where I heard there was a great warrior, and where I met Sensei Rockharth." Her expression goes from a happy-go-lucky smile to more of a somber poker face as she looks to Ford "Would you like me to go on?" (edited)
impulsive ram 06-May-20 02:25 PM
"if your comfortable with doing so sure. This sounds pretty interesting so I'd like to hear it." He orders three more drinks for the two of them. One for him and two for her to tie up the score.
Jad (: (Armi, Kalas, Volya) 06-May-20 02:33 PM
She smiles "I'd love to go on, now don't get me wrong, talking about my life isn't what makes me all somber, it's just reminiscing about it that gets me thinking" She takes a drink from her whiskey "I trained with Rockharth for seven years, he taught me how to properly wield a blade. He took a vow of blindness decades before he met me, so training with him took more patience from me than it did from him. For our final lesson we had a spar, and somehow after training me, that blind bastard of a dwarf took me down without even seeing me. When I took my leave, he removed his blindfold and sent me on my way. He taught me more than Minato ever could have, but the experience was entirely different. I traveled along to border of Denoxian lands, the immense military force was impressive, but it made me realize that my sword and my legs weren't enough to help people. It was around this time I heard of an Elven assassin. I can't legally say his name, due to him promising to kill me if I snitch, but he taught me the proper ways to use a sidearm in combat." She finishes her drink and looks to Ford "Now, do you want me to catch you up to where this story is now?"
impulsive ram 06-May-20 03:12 PM

After far too long, I eventually stopped walking and got a carriage ride up to Éire. And when I arrived and saw the Steelhearts Airship, I knew I had to join...and then I realized I left my sword and gun on the carriage. I used some of my funds to grab some replacement weapons and some supplies. And now here I am, with only a shortsword I bartered off some merchant, a handful of darts I was handed on the street, and this necklace I got from home. And that brings us to where we are today." She looks to Ford enthusiastically "Well that's the gist of it. What do you think?"

Iri | Sela | Hal - FERTILE 01-Jun-20 07:57 PM
Hal crinkled her nose, snapping back to the moment when she heard Kor restate what she could tell was some sort of derogatory insult. She looked over at the centaur then, her eyes moving from him and to each manâ€”monster?â€”sitting around the table. The girl tilted her head then, thoughts drifting back to the strange things Garg had mentioned. If the ship was indeed being powered by a sort of... heart... was that how the airship got its name? Suddenly, she shivered and then stood up from her seat, nearly knocking over her mug. With shaky hands, she caught the thing, setting it down on the table with an awkward and rather loud clink. â€œThe engine...â€ Hal then muttered, a soft whisper barely audible on her breath. In that moment, she knew what she needed to find. If it was even possible at all. Face turning red, she then looked at everyone, suddenly feeling self conscious, like a silly spectacle to ogle. Embarrassed, she just smiled weakly, letting out a nervous laugh to try and cover up how she was feeling. â€œWell, itâ€™s getting late,â€ she finally managed, an uneasiness about her tone. â€œAnd it was really nice getting to talk with all of you too. Well... most of you...â€ She eyed the silent Dragonborn held tightly by Gargâ€™s side. â€œI do hope we can all chat again.â€ The girl then nodded at everyone and began heading for the exit. â€œI... Iâ€™m off to bed...â€ At that, Hal left her mug, still full, behind on the table. She turned her full attention on the door now, ready to head to her room for some sleep. For in the morning, she had an engine to find. An engine she decided just might be... the steal heart. (Exit to #quarters-deck ).

After ordering some wine fit for daydrinking, he makes light chatter with the barkeep present, and breaks the ice to any other patrons by asking about the job board's most recent post, such as their opinion on it, or the dangers likely to be presented on such work. Clearly, the man is just looking to start some conversation; his northern Eurasian accent, duo of bags, noticeably robust figure, questions, and peculiar green and purple robes providing a clear indication that no one onboard has seen him before- a fresh face amongst the crowd.' Reese (Thrinâœ¨Tomaraâœ¨Parker) 26-Jul-20 10:18 PM
Tomara follows suit, though he finds a tall barstool to be closer to eye level with the barbarian. "You'd be correct there, my friend. It is a bit more complicated than simply realm hopping, though. Hm... Ah, here." After ordering a fruity alcohol, failing to get that, and sticking to a strong ale, the tabaxi takes a page from his journal and draws a few circles. It's recognizable as a rudimentary diagram of a planar system. Beside it, he draws another of these. He taps the two diagrams. "The realms you're familiar with are part of a larger universe, and I'm from a universe outside of the one you know. It has largely the same setup- a prime material plane, astral plane, plane of thought, the home of gods, etcetera. It's fairly straightforward. My home is much more advanced technologically though, what with having more time to get there. The institute I mentioned is the head of most free information and advancements, and I was part of a project testing the multiverse theory." He goes on about this for a few minutes, releasing an almost imperceptible sort of tension as he explains the situation. When it's done he has his ale, and takes nearly ten seconds drinking from the flagon. "I'm sorry. It's a lot to get into, but I hope it explains why I'm in a bit more of a pickle than would be caused by just travelling between the realms in my own universe." (edited)
(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 26-Jul-20 10:24 PM
It takes a good few minutes, and the entirety of the first ale that Jonny had ordered for him to ruminate over so many grandiose concepts, but he gets the general gist, and proceeds to comment bluntly; "Huh... Well, shit. An' here I thought ya might be able to buy a ticket out with enough coin and access to one o' them grand wizard types, but... Well, that's a whole lot more complicated, innit?" He shakes his head a bit, and lets out a sigh. "But then, it always is. So, what d'you do, then? Are you just... Stuck, or..?"
Reese (Thrinâœ¨Tomaraâœ¨Parker) 26-Jul-20 10:38 PM

(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 26-Jul-20 10:43 PM

(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 27-Jul-20 05:12 PM

Reese (Thrinâœ¨Tomaraâœ¨Parker) 27-Jul-20 05:27 PM

(Joe) Jonny | Ferisso | Atakhi 27-Jul-20 05:37 PM
The Goliath drains the last of his ale, chuckling. Then, with a playful smirk of his own, Jonny leans in and pecks the spellcaster on the lips, before suddenly sweeping Tomara up and into his arms. Letting the cat settle into a bridal/princess carry, the goliath started heading for the door out of the bar area, toward the quarters deck. "Point me in the right direction, kitty. Might as well let you get accustomed to not having use of your own legs on the way there, this'll most certainly be some exhaustive research we're doing."
Reese (Thrinâœ¨Tomaraâœ¨Parker) 27-Jul-20 05:53 PM

Dungeon Master BOT 24-Aug-20 01:07 PM
In that moment, when everyone was getting ready to leave the bar and retire for the night. Hamdrock the silent dwarf barkeep walked to the table. "This is for you." He said to Sela and dropped a closed letter and a note. Then he gathered all the empty plates and glasses, cleaning up the table and silently going away. The note was from the Guild Master himself, addressed to Sela.
Lady Selaphiel. I have received a curious request for aid. Instead of posting it on the job board, I have decided to assign it to you since I believe that you are the one most capable for this task. Cassius Clay.
The letter itself was a short one, the seal was a simple lone tree, the paper from good quality and the writing was in elvish. A little fancy but obviously came from a person in need of help.
Hail thee of might and valor, I, the Lord of Safe Heaven, send you honor - with despair. My people, refugees from the feywild war, is dissapearing. For over hundreds of years, since the first rumours of conflict started in our homeland, we have been living here. Safe. Until recent moons. Now my dear people is scared. We fear our own shadows. Something unholy must be happening, for we, the child of Fey, are people of arts, nature and love. So I say to you, don't give us up for dead and encircle this land with the symbols of good. There is much wealth in this community. I offer all that might be had to thee and thy fellows if thou shalt but answer my desperate plea. Come quickly, for our time is at hand! All that I can give shall be thine! Wyrran Meliamne Founder and Lord of Safe Heaven
Dungeon Master BOT 24-Aug-20 01:17 PM

After all that happened, he was sure they all would get a good rest. Nothing was better than some training and a good time with friend to have pleasant dreams. After gathering this things and properly fastening his heavy shield to his left arm, Bofwant offered his right hand to Sela. Once she grabbed it, he started the journey back to their room while mentally making a list of things he would need to get ready in the morning. First he needed to leave a note for Miss Mipha in the med bay and then gather the emergency medical supplies he had left.
Mors | Garg | Bof 29-Aug-20 11:56 AM
(Fade to black I guess?)
